statement: A 50 kg mass is suspended by two cables. Cable A is horizontal, and Cable B is at 45 degrees. Find the Tension in Cable B ($T_B$). Use $g = 9.81 m/s^2$.
A 20 kg cylinder rests on a smooth 30-degree incline. Find the Normal Force ($N$) acting on the cylinder.
A uniform 10 kg beam is supported by a pin at A and a cable at B. Find the vertical Reaction Force at A ($A_y$).
In a simple bridge truss, a vertical load of 10 kN is applied at the center. If the truss is symmetric, find the Support Reaction ($R$) at one end.
For a triangle truss with 60-degree angles and a 5 kN load at the top vertex, find the Force in the horizontal member ($F_{AB}$).
Identify the number of Zero-Force Members in a Pratt truss under a single point load at the support.
Find the Centroid ($\bar{y}$) of a rectangle with base 4 m and height 6 m relative to the base.
Calculate the Area Moment of Inertia ($I_x$) for a square section with side length $a = 0.2 m$.
Find the Area of a circle with a diameter of 0.5 m.
A rigid bar is balanced on a pivot. A 10 N force is 2 m left of the pivot. What Force ($F$) is needed 4 m right of the pivot to maintain equilibrium?
Find the Moment ($M$) at the fixed support of a 3 m cantilever beam with a 100 N downward force at the tip.
Two people carry a 60 kg log. Person A is at one end, Person B is 1/3 from the other end. Find Force ($F_B$).
A car accelerates from rest at $2 m/s^2$. Find its Velocity ($v$) after 10 seconds.
A particle moves with $s(t) = 3t^2 + 2t$. Find the Acceleration ($a$) at $t = 5 s$.
How much Distance ($d$) is required to stop a vehicle traveling at 30 m/s with a deceleration of $5 m/s^2$?
A ball is kicked at 20 m/s at an angle of 45 degrees. Find the Maximum Height ($H$). Use $g = 9.81 m/s^2$.
For the same ball (20 m/s, 45 deg), find the horizontal Range ($R$).
A projectile is fired horizontally from a 50 m cliff at 10 m/s. Find the Time of flight ($t$).
A car travels on a circular track of radius 100 m at a constant speed of 20 m/s. Find the Normal Acceleration ($a_n$).
If the car in the previous problem increases speed at $2 m/s^2$, find the Total Acceleration ($a_{total}$).
A particle moves on a path where $\rho = 50 m$. At a certain point, $a_n = 8 m/s^2$. Find the Velocity ($v$).
A robotic arm extends at $\dot{r} = 0.5 m/s$ while rotating at $\dot{\theta} = 2 rad/s$. If $r = 1 m$, find the radial Velocity ($v_r$).
Using the same arm ($r=1, \dot{r}=0.5, \dot{\theta}=2$), find the transverse Velocity ($v_{\theta}$).
A particle moves such that $r = 2 m$ (constant) and $\dot{\theta} = 3 rad/s$. Find the Magnitude of Acceleration ($a$).
